ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Have you thought about the fire that you light?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Consider the fire that you strike (and get by friction).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Did you consider the fire which you kindle?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Have you seen the fire which you kindle?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: So what is your opinion regarding the fire which you kindle?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Do you not see the fire which you kindle.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Have you considered the fire which you strike?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Have you considered the fire you kindle?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Have ye observed the fire which ye strike out;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Have you thought about the fire that you kindle.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Behold! - the fire which ye strike out:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Have you considered the fire that you kindle?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: See ye the Fire which ye kindle?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Tell Me! The fire which you kindle,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Have you thought about the fire you kindle?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Have you seen the fire you kindle?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And have you seen the fire that you ignite?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [56:71] Have you considered the fire that you kindle?, [the fire] which you produce out of the [oil of] green trees?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Have ye observed the Fire which ye strike out) from every dry twig except for the twigs of the Jujube tree;
